definition:
Let ${\mathfrak{g}}$ be a Lie algebra. Then a [*Cartan subalgebra*]{} is
a maximal subalgebra of ${\mathfrak{g}}$ which is
[*self-normalizing*]{}, that is, if $[g,h]\in{\mathfrak{h}}$ for all
$h\in{\mathfrak{h}}$, then $g\in{\mathfrak{h}}$ as well. Any Cartan
subalgebra ${\mathfrak{h}}$ is nilpotent, and if ${\mathfrak{g}}$ is
semi-simple, it is abelian. All Cartan subalgebras of a Lie algebra are
conjugate by the adjoint action of any Lie group with algebra
${\mathfrak{g}}$.

The dimension of ${\mathfrak{h}}$ is called the [*rank*]{} of
${\mathfrak{g}}$.
